channel.title: Talks By Franklin D. Richards
channel.description: General Conference talks by Franklin D. Richards.

image.title: General Conference talks by Franklin D. Richards.

item.title: The Law of Abundance
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I feel it both a privilege and a blessing to be present at this inspirational conference, and I know that the answers to many of today’s problems are to be found in the messages being given by our leaders.

item.title: The Purpose of Life: To Be Proved
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I stand before you with a humble heart. I am grateful for the privilege of attending this semiannual conference and have been inspired by the words of our great leaders. We have received counsel that will be helpful to u

item.title: The Importance of Prayer
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, this has indeed been a wonderful conference—another inspiring spiritual experience. I have been deeply impressed and strengthened by the prayers, the music, and the spoken word.

item.title: “Thy Will Be Done, O Lord”
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I come before you with a humble heart and rejoice with you in the marvelous spirit of this conference.

item.title: The Continuing Power of the Holy Ghost
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters: This has been a most stimulating and inspiring conference, and I sincerely pray for the guidance of the Spirit in the things that I have to say to you.

item.title: Testimony
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I have truly been inspired by the words of our beloved prophet as well as my brethren. The beautiful prayer and music have likewise contributed to making this conference another remarkable spiritual experience.

item.title: The Blessings of Peace
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I approach this responsibility with a humble heart, and pray the Spirit of the Lord will be with us while I speak to you.

item.title: The Message of Easter
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I am grateful for the privilege of attending this inspirational conference, and I am confident that the answers to many of today’s pressing problems are to be found in the messages being given by our leaders.

item.title: “Seek Not for Riches But for Wisdom”
item.description: My beloved brethren, we are living in a most interesting and remarkable age, when the Spirit of the Lord is being poured out on the face of the earth abundantly; but it is also an age of permissiveness, tribulations, and unhappiness, when many men’s

item.title: Perfecting the Saints
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters: The counsel of President Kimball and my Brethren, as well as the beautiful music and opening prayer, have made this a most inspirational meeting.

item.title: Lengthening Your Stride as a Missionary
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I rejoice with you in the spirit of this conference and the inspirational messages which have been delivered.

item.title: Personal and Family Financial Preparedness
item.description: My dear brethren, I rejoice with you in the wonderful spirit of this priesthood meeting.

item.title: Life—A Great Proving Ground
item.description: President Kimball, I express the feelings of the people of this worldwide Church in saying that we love you, President Tanner, President Romney, and are grateful that the Lord has performed miracles in your lives so that you can continue to carry on

item.title: LDS Hymns—Worshiping with Song
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I rejoice with you in the spirit of this great conference and pray for the guidance of the Holy Spirit as I speak to you.

item.title: Be a Peacemaker
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters—yes, ye are all brothers and sisters—the counsel of my Brethren, as well as the beautiful music and the opening prayer, have made this a most inspirational meeting.

item.title: Happiness and Joy in Temple Work
item.description: We have heard how the Holy Ghost directs us. I remember years ago in a temple meeting that President David O. McKay suggested that even though you prepare a talk ten days before conference, the Lord can inspire you then as well as when you are at the

item.title: Opportunities to Serve
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, as I have listened to the words of the Brethren this afternoon, much has been said about sacrifice. I couldn’t help but think of the words of that great hymn, “Sacrifice brings forth the blessings of heaven” (“Praise to
